fields.description:
h1. Summary
When merging a pull request fails, the UI does raises and error and the loading spinner never goes away:

{code}
#!log

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'responseJSON' of undefined
    at f.error (merge-button-dialog.js:48)
    at Object.<anonymous> (merge-button-dialog.js:43)
{code}

Please note, fast forward merges are only possibly if no changes have been made to the destination branch.

h1. How to Replicate
# Open a PR in a browser window
# Outside the browser window, update the destination branch to introduce a merge conflict
# In the open window, try to merge the PR
# The loading spinner will remain indefinitely
fields.summary: UI does not display an appropriate error message when failing to merge a PR
Cannot merge a compare. Getting 500 response on initial AJAX request

fields.description:
I have been using the Cassandra service in Bitbucket pipelines for a couple months now but today I noticed a drastic increase in service setup time that is causing my build pipeline to fail.  Prior to today it seemed like the average startup time was around 8 or 9 seconds.  Currently the startup time over 60 seconds which is a 750%+ increase.  This increase in startup time is not specific to a single repository and happens on new pipelines as well as other pipeline builds that have previously run successfully.  The same Cassandra image version is being used between prior working builds and current slow builds.  Multiple coworkers at my company are reporting the same issue.

If there are no changes to the repository, build pipeline, or images, this seems like it might be a symptom of another issue.

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Define the Cassandra service in one of your build steps
# Monitor the "cassandra" tab and watch the timestamps as Cassandra is starting up

*Expected result:*

The Cassandra service should setup in a relatively predictable amount of time between builds (not varying by 750%+).
fields.summary: Bitbucket cassandra service setup time increased drastically increased

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to add a new team member by using the email address and having a space at the back, the dialog box loads indefinitely.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:###
# Access the *User Groups* page for a team account's settings: https://bitbucket.org/account/user/<team name>/groups/
# Click on *Add member*
# Input an email address to add a team member and put a space at the back of the name. Eg. "test@test.com "

h3. Expected Results###
Either the user with the "test@test.com" email will be added or an error message will pop up and say the user is not found.

h3. Actual Results
The spinner will spin indefinitely  and the network console shows the following error:

{code}
#!html

15 Uncaught SyntaxError: Unexpected token < in JSON at position 0
    at Object.parse (<anonymous>)
    at r (add-member.js:41)
    at Object.<anonymous> (add-member.js:71)
    at c (jquery.js:3099)
    at Object.fireWith [as rejectWith] (jquery.js:3211)
    at n (jquery.js:8266)
    at XMLHttpRequest.<anonymous> (jquery.js:8605)
    at XMLHttpRequest.n (raven.js?ae06:314)
    at XMLHttpRequest.nrWrapper ((index):15)
{code}

h3. Notes
The issue does not happen if you try to add a member with a username. Eg. "testuser111 "; It will fail and say the user is not found.
fields.summary: Trying to add a new team member with a space at the back of the name will load indefinitely.

fields.description:
Dear developers,

I ’d like to have the FreePascal programming language in the language list.\\
I think that the FreePascal community (https://www.freepascal.org/) isn’t too small and its RAD IDE Lazarus extends the community far wider (http://www.lazarus-ide.org/). I use it on a daily basis and can state that it’s a mature Pascal tool.

I found an issue [#7236|BCLOUD-7236] asking to add Lazarus to the known languages but that issue was closed due to inactivity. So I’m raising new activity to attract attention to this particular programming language.

I’ve found ObjectPascal in the list but that’s in fact the language that was developed for Delphi. FreePascal can simulate it in a directive-driven mode but it’s in fact another language.

I’ve got three repositories written in FreePascal/Lazarus:

https://bitbucket.org/cigydd/cocr

https://bitbucket.org/cigydd/minigolfeecheck

https://bitbucket.org/cigydd/sudoctor
fields.summary: Add FreePascal to the list of repository prorgamming languages

fields.description: character for one-third (⅓) and one-sixth (⅙) not displaying properly in web browser view of file in repo. Thanks.
fields.summary: Unicode not displaying

fields.description:
We have noticed our pipelines failed with this error message (last 7 days).\\
Sometimes it works fine, sometimes it ends with this error message. It looks that it's not caused by changes in our code. We are using pipeline for couple of months and most of time it works fine. All this long builds are counted by our run-time usage...
fields.summary: Exceeded build time limit of 120 minutes.

fields.description:
Pull Requests are extremely handy to have a conversation about code, but the notification system is pretty cumbersome. At the moment the best we can do it poke notifications to a specific Room. This can get very spammy, particularly if there's only a few reviewers + author in the PR.

Surely a better solution would be an option to directly notify the individual users in HipChat, rather than tie to a room?

An even better solution from a UX point of view would be to create a temporary room for each PR. Then all comments can just be mirrored in the room, and users directly notified if comments have been made. This would be bi-directional, although you would have to push comments made from chat into the top level comments section in the PR (or add a / command to reply directly in the source thread i.e against the bit of code that we're talking about).
fields.summary: better integration between HipChat / Stride and Pull Requests

fields.description:
When reviewing code it would be useful to be able to create draft comments which are viewable only by the reviewer until such time they decide to post them.

This will allow you to make notes for yourself as you read down through the code or comments which you may want to edit prior to post or even completely discard - as they may change form as you further look through the code (especially for larger requests).

Comments as it stands the author gets a notification for each comment (and a notification for each subsequent edit of a comment) and may also immediately start to read/review them.
fields.summary: Allow the creation of draft comments when reviewing pull requests
API error  {"type": "error", "error": {"message": "target_user"}}

fields.description: "aria-pressed" attribute didn't set after click.
fields.summary: [UI] "Mine" tab on "Pull requests" page don't highlighted when active, other tabs are highlighted

fields.description:
So the issue is basically code duplication.

I currently have a pipeline similar to this

{code}
#!yaml

pipelines:
    branches:
        master:
            - parallel:
                - step:
                    name: Test
                    image: chialab/php:7.2
                    caches:
                        - composer
                    script:
                        - composer install --no-progress --no-suggest
                        - vendor/bin/phpunit
                - step:
                    name: Webpack
                    image: node:carbon
                    caches:
                        - node
                    script:
                        - yarn install
                        - yarn run build
                    artifacts:
                        - web/build/**
                - step:
                    name: Composer
                    image: chialab/php:7.2
                    caches:
                        - composer
                    script:
                        - composer install --no-dev --no-progress --no-suggest --optimize-autoloader --classmap-authoritative
                    artifacts:
                        - vendor/**
            - step:
                name: Deploy
                deployment: Production
                script:
                    - rsync [...]
{code}

This is for live deployment. But I would also like the test and webpack step to run on all branches. So the only way (that I know of) is to copy paste them into other branch definitions.

I would much rather have something like this:

{code}
#!yaml

pipelines:
    default:
        - parallel:
            - step: test
            - step: webpack
    branches:
        master:
            - parallel:
                - step: test
                - step: webpack
                - step: composer
            - step:
                name: Deploy
                deployment: Production
                script:
                    - rsync [...]

definitions:
    steps:
        test:
            name: Test
            image: chialab/php:7.2
            caches:
                - composer
            script:
                - composer install --no-progress --no-suggest
                - vendor/bin/phpunit
        webpack:
            name: Webpack
            image: node:carbon
            caches:
                - node
            script:
                - yarn install
                - yarn run build
            artifacts:
                - web/build/**
        composer:
            name: Composer
            image: chialab/php:7.2
            caches:
                - composer
            script:
                - composer install --no-dev --no-progress --no-suggest --optimize-autoloader --classmap-authoritative
            artifacts:
                - vendor/**

{code}
fields.summary: pipeline reuse steps

fields.description:
We have a problem with the commits list since a commit pushed this morning (it is a private repository https://bitbucket.org/marcom-connect/eschedule-lite)

* Commits for specific branches (https://bitbucket.org/marcom-connect/eschedule-lite/commits/branch/feature%2F9545%2Fgdpr) and master (https://bitbucket.org/marcom-connect/eschedule-lite/commits/branch/master) do not show anything (just the message "No commits to display.")
* Commits for all branches show only commits before 2018-02-22 (https://bitbucket.org/marcom-connect/eschedule-lite/commits/all).
* Branches and pull request do not show any changes any more (https://bitbucket.org/marcom-connect/eschedule-lite/branch/feature/9545/gdpr).
* Source tree shows correctly last commits of this repository (https://bitbucket.org/marcom-connect/eschedule-lite/src/master/)

It worked fine this morning until we pushed this commit to master (https://bitbucket.org/marcom-connect/eschedule-lite/commits/3854e53af0893ea226f750f805c0e125afe0c332)
fields.summary: Commits list does not show anything since last commit

fields.description:
h1. Context and actual behaviour:
I renamed a file using the web interface and I noticed by the colours in the commit diff that the first line had changed, although no changes were actually visible in the text itself.

The file is a plain text file that must be able to hold some non-ASCII characters, and so had been marked with a ([Unicode BOM|http://unicode.org/faq/utf_bom.html#BOM]) at the beginning.

When I viewed the raw commit, I could see that some strange characters (presumably the BOM) had been removed from the start of the first line.

h1. Desired behaviour:
The file should have been renamed, but the contents should have been identical.
fields.summary: On renaming a file, it lost its UTF-8 BOM

fields.description:
A user who is a member of a Team Account via a user group (with only repository access and no Create Repository or Administrator access), will not be able to see the list of Teams that they have access to.

To be able to see the list of teams that a user has access to, the group the user is in is required to have either one of the following account permissions.

# Create repositories
# Administer team

For example, a user account which is a member of a team "testpermission" via group which does not have the permission "Create Repositories" or "Administer Team". This group has Write access to repositories. The team "testpermission" is not visible on the users account as below.

!3320496466-teams.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to see list of Teams user is a member of

fields.description:
Bitbucket Cloud users unable to upgrade, or change billing information if the Company name field has more than 2 characters.

h2. WORKAROUND:
If you run into this error, try entering your company name with only 2 characters
fields.summary: Bitbucket Cloud users unable to upgrade, or change billing information if the Company name field has more than 2 characters.: (BBCS-113)

fields.description:
In the API we can see the repo's that are forked from a repo but we are not able to see how many commits behind they are.

We have a central repo that we generate a template with changes and teams fork from this and need to keep it up to date and therefore it would make sense to rack the number of changed behind the master repo.

This was visible in the old UI but has since disappeared in the new UI and is not visible in the API at all (according to support)
fields.summary: API Should Show Commits behind Repo Forked from

fields.description:
It appears there was a change to how we display custom builds on the deployment log. To reproduce:

{code}
#!python

pipelines:
  custom: # Pipelines that can only be triggered manually
    sonar:
      - step:
          script:
            - echo "Manual triggers for Sonar are awesome!"
    deployment-to-prod:
      - step:
          script:
            - echo "Manual triggers for deployments are awesome!"
  branches:  # Pipelines that run automatically on a commit to a branch can also be triggered manually
    staging:
      - step:
          script:
            - echo "Automated pipelines are cool too."
{code}

You can select the "custom" builds in the Pipelines view, however, you won't see this reflect under the log below. We only display the commit SHA and branch.
fields.summary: Display custom pipeline information on Pipelines page

fields.description:
If a user creates a README or README.txt file in a repository with a setup.py file at the root, it will be rendered as Markdown in the new source view UI rather than reStructuredText.

An ".rst" extension can be added to the file(s) as a workaround.
fields.summary: reStructuredText formatting is no longer applied to .txt or extensionless markup files in repositories with a setup.py

fields.description:
We keep running into the same error message, for two weeks already now:

"While we check things on our end, refresh the page and contact support if the problem persists.

When contacting support, provide them with this code:

88ec7426f95d4e77b8c94574ee040b78"

Could you help?
fields.summary: Something went wrong

fields.description: After merging a pull request, it would be nice to get redirected to the list of pull requests so I can just jump to the next one.
fields.summary: Go back to pull request list after merging a pull request

fields.description:
h3. Summary

* When changing the Bitbucket username, the user will be redirected to a login page.
* The login page will then have the new username populated on it.
* Attempting to login afterwards will show the error "You can no longer log in with a username. Use your Atlassian account email address (*******@*******.com) instead."
* In this case, the logical behavior should be having the login page automatically populated with the user's email address instead of the username.
fields.summary: Prepopulate email in login form after changing username

fields.description:
As a admin I would like to be able to have a delay time that I can set for the start of a new build.

Frequently I'm reviewing and  merging a number of tickets/branches that all need to be merged into development. I then trigger new builds every few minutes. If there was a user definable delay the build would only start if no new merges have been done the last n minutes.

It will be more efficient and will save resources. Not the least it will save money as I'm pushing artefacts to AWS-S3 and invalidate cloudfront etc...
fields.summary: Only run pipeline for the latest push to the repo if multiple changes are pushed

fields.description: Issue with mail alert to DL if we commit to a repository branch
fields.summary: Issue with mail alert to DL if we commit to a repository branch

fields.description:
Found a couple of mistakes in one of your git tutorial pages - for git pull:\\
https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/syncing/git-pull

i) "In this diagram, we can now see that a rebase pull does create the new H commit." -> it should be "does NOT create"

ii) Also, in the illustration picture above, I believe the proper order of the commit history should be: D - A - B - C - E' - F' - G' on the local branch after rebasing.
fields.summary: Mistakes in git pull tutorial

fields.description:
Pull requests can be hard to manage at the moment where other reviewers may approve a request while you are in the middle of a review and then the whole thing can be merged.

I want the ability to be able to block the pull request until I have approved the request (or anyone can say they want to block it till they have approved it )

Currently you can kind of hack it by creating a task which will block the PR till it's ticked.

I would imagine I'd just click a button called "Reviewing" and have a rule "Don't allow merge with active reviewers"  or some such.
fields.summary: Ability to become a reviewer that must accept before Pull request can be merged

fields.description:
We currently use chmod 777 for cloning purposes across different build containers (we are unable to determine the UID that the customer build container will run as, so we don't run 022)

We should document the reason why we use the permissions that we do in Pipelines
fields.summary: Document permissions usage in Bitbucket Pipelines

fields.description:
Under the new Pull request UI, if someone tries to merge a pull request when they do not have the correct permissions to do so (under branch permissions), we will give a "400 Bad Request" error.

We should error out with something a bit more useful in this scenario.
fields.summary: New PR UI: Trying to merge a pull request without correct permissions results in "400: Bad request"

fields.description:
We have several services on different bitbucket repositories that share the exact same bitbucket-pipelines configuration, and it's really exhausting (and also a source to a lot of bugs), when we need to update this configuration.

It would be much more efficient to share the same bitbucket-pipelines configuration among those services, ie the ability to specify an external bitbucket-pipelines.yml file or even better a repository.
fields.summary: use external bitbucket-pipelines config

fields.description: When I try a side-by-side view of my code in a pull request (in Bitbucket Cloud), the right-hand side does not display at all.
fields.summary: side-by-side view (pull request) is not working

Steps to reproduce:

# Go to any Pull Request
# Inside PR: click on issue link (in PR name) - pop-up with issue should open
# Click on picture inside an issue

Actual result:\\
Picture opens under issue pop-up and unavailable to see

Expected result:\\
Picture should be available to see
fields.summary: Incorrect display of pictures attached to issue

fields.description:
Firefox Quantum now supports U2F, can you please support it?

Thank you very much.
fields.summary: Please support FIDO U2F with Firefox.

fields.description: Looks like Clojure syntax highlighting existed at some point (#270), but As of today I'm seeing completely black and white fonts.
fields.summary: Clojure syntax highlighting not working

fields.description:
We have multiple repositories and so multiple deployments configured and it works all very neat so far!

It would be nice to have an overview of the different deployments.

Repositories can be grouped into a project so it could be a project deployments dashboard page that can show the statuses of each repository in it. This way you can easily see what repositories have pending Production deployments and so on.
fields.summary: Dashboard for viewing deployment statuses of multiple repositories

fields.description:
As we transition to pipelines, I've been trying to sort out our docker caching so that it reliably caches (and to fix some actual bugs that had crept in but weren't terribly noticeable with our previous build system). I got it caching but then as I kept tweaking the Dockerfile, I noticed it stopped caching. First I checked locally with docker on my mac (fairly recent version of docker) that:

* if I built twice in a row, the second run found cache for all layers
* if I built once, then modified some file in our source tree, the cache was invalidated at the correct step (the on that adds most of the source)

I then confirmed that if I rebuilt my branch with that dockerfile multiple times in pipelines that it wasn't using cache. It showed that it was downloading the cache during the "Build setup" phase but then at the end it didn't upload any new  cache and the layers were all rebuilt.

I then deleted the Docker cache in the web UI:

!2382649172-Screen%20Shot%202018-06-01%20at%2010.53.55%20AM.png|thumbnail!

Then I ran the build twice again and it cached properly.

So it appears that the docker cache is very static -- that is, it isn't extracting all layers built by the current run of docker build and _adding_ them to the existing cache. It only uploads any cache for future use if there was no cache to start.

Is this a correct description of how caching works? If so, is there any plan to fix this? That is not how docker caches when you run your own build server with its own docker daemon.

The major issue here is if a developer modifies the Dockerfile (even adding comments to a line can invalidate a step!) then the cache becomes useless, extending our build time. Not all developers are going to remember to go delete the cache manually when they merge such changes to master.
fields.summary: docker cache appears to need manual deletion to work consistently

fields.description:
As an admin for my team I have good control over who can do what on team git repositories. But I have no control over who can create snippets.

Furthermore, snippets are made public by default. It is often created under the team member's personal account instead of the team account. This makes the mistake even harder to spot.

In the interest of information security, I would like the ability to disable the use of snippets altogether for my team members. Either:

# team members may not use Snippets at all, even for their personal account. Or
# make it impossible to create Snippets which are private to the team. This way there is no misunderstanding about whether the Snippet is shared with the team or with the world.
fields.summary: Team setting to disable use of Snippets for members
Mentioning user with `_` in front of their username does not work

fields.description: I want the ability to configure my email notifications such that I get an email when I'm added to a pull request *and never get another email about that pull request again*.
fields.summary: Granular Pull Request Notification Settings

fields.description:
Following on from [this question|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Edit-BitBucket-Projects/qaq-p/791429] I recently started using the Projects feature, and I think it's great. However, we have some issues with it.

h1. Issues
# *[Repositories can't be in more than one project|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Can-a-repository-belong-to-multiple-projects/qaq-p/356072].*

## *Suggestion:* allow repos to be in multiple projects.
## *Usecase:* we are migrating our CI over to bitbucket pipelines. It'd be great to have a projects to track all repos that don't have bitbucket pipelines. That way it'd be easy to track our progress and see what repos still need to be updated. However, that would mean we can't have those repos be in any other project, which is an issue for us since we already use projects to group certain types of repo together, for example, all of our puppet repos are grouped together in a project.
# *You can't remove a repository from a project without deleting it or moving it to a different project.*

## *Suggestion:* allow repos to be removed from projects and exist outside any project
## *Usecase:* human error. I've added repos to a project on error, only to find I can't undo that mistake. I can only move the repo to another project or delete the repo. There are some repos that just don't belong in any project. It should be possible to remove them from a project without deleting them.
# *You can't delete a project without deleting or moving all the repositories it contains.*

## *Suggestion:* allow projects to be deleted or archived without moving or deleting every repo in the project
## *Usecase:* In some cases a project can be completely finished but the repos should still exist after the project is completed. For example. maybe your org needs to do a large scale audit of every repo that has a production instance. It would make sense to group them together using a project. You could argue that you could add the repos at the start and remove them one by one as you go through the audit. However, if there is a final sign off stage by higher management, as there usually is with audits, it'd make sense to leave all repos in the project until that sign off has been done, and then delete the project but *not the repos* once the process is complete.

I know this seems like a lot of requests, but I think all of these could be satisfied with minimal changes, by making it so that projects contain links to repos, rather than direct copyies.

Thanks for reading.
fields.summary: Repositories can't be in more than one Project.

fields.description:
I authenticate my cloud account in source tree by refreshing the OAuth token, and I receive the message that "Authentification OK" with a green check mark.

Then I go to fetch or push to the repo, and it asks me again the ID/PW. Even though I provide the ID/PW, it just keeps asking again and again without ever letting me push/fetch from the remote.

This bug renders source tree completely unusable.

fields.description:
Issue BCLOUD-13895 added a default merge strategy for a repository, but it has to be configured manually on all repositories. That's not a scalable solution; it would be nice to be able to [configure|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%257Busername%257D/%257Brepo_slug%257D#put] the merge strategy for existing repositories, and (optionally/ideally) to set it at the time a repository is [created|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%257Busername%257D/%257Brepo_slug%257D#post].

(Please also consider making all new administration UI features part of the REST API, e.g. BCLOUD-16227.)
fields.summary: Expose default merge strategy through the REST API

fields.description:
Right now, the default squash merge commit message is a combination of some header text, the PR number, the PR title, the commit messages, and the approver.

This is inconvenient for my team, as we prefer to just merge on top of the destination with the same commit message as the head of the source branch (like a rebase, but that's not supported). Having all this merge metadata in the commit message is completely unnecessary for our purposes.

It would be nice if we could configure the default squash merge commit message for our repo to be just the commit messages (ideally just the head commit message, since we squash before pushing anyway). This would allow us to avoid making large, ugly commit messages on accident and would streamline the merge process.

P.S. Was going to make a comment on this issue, but they said to open a new issue:\\
BCLOUD-13633
fields.summary: Configure default squash merge commit message for repo

fields.description: After creating a pull request that had "@Async" in the description I see "@Gonzalo Perez Bustelo" once it is saved (it is a link to https://bitbucket.org/Async/)

fields.description:
*Problem:* As a code reviewer, I'm often faced with performing PR triage, working my way through a significant number of PRs that require my approval. It would be handy if I could identify tiny PRs (eg, a 1-line dependency bump) to approve quickly so they're not bottle-necked by the larger PRs.

*Proposed Solution:* Add a "Lines changed" column to the "Pull requests to review" list, displaying total number of lines added and total number of lines removed (similar to the indicator shown next to each file changed inside a PR).
fields.summary: Add "Lines Changed" column to "Pull requests to review" list

fields.description: Our pipeline is strangely failing on an import error in Python. The same pipeline runs fine on our local server though (in the same Docker image). It started to fail randomly some time ago, now every new run fails. In fact even re-running a passing pipeline fails (see https://bitbucket.org/compass-tokamak/hdc/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/48). The important error is {{ImportError: No module named 'cyhdc'}}, which is the Python module that is built by the script.

fields.description:
Hello guys.\\ Recently we have found that Pipelines start failing because of unsupported version of docker registry. Error message: {code} #!bash rpc error: code = Unknown desc = Error response from daemon: error parsing HTTP 404 response body: invalid character '<' looking for beginning of value: "\n404 Not Found\n

Not Found

\n

The requested URL was not found on the server. If you entered the URL manually please check your spelling and try again.

\n" {code} Is there some possibility to set docker engine version inside bitbucket-pipelines.yml?\\ Thanks. Looking forward,\\ Volodymyr Shynkar

fields.description:
On Firefox 60 on x64 Linux, code in markdown (see screenshot, from https://bitbucket.org/marshallpierce/ktor-csrf/src/master/) renders noticeably smaller than the surrounding normal text, which is understandable given that it's set to use {{font-size: 12px}} vs the {{font-size: 14px}} used elsewhere. If I adjust its {{font-size}} to 14px, it looks the same size  as the normal text.

On Chrome 66 on the same OS, rendering appears closer to what macOS Firefox does, which has the text all approximately the same size.

Despite being in the minority, it seems like Firefox/Linux's behavior is actually correct, in that it's displaying 12px text as smaller than 14px...
fields.summary: Code blocks in Markdown font is smaller than surrounding text on Linux
Side By Side comparison Issue

fields.description:
[An issue has been opened at NPM's repo|https://github.com/npm/npm/issues/20819]

It looks like Bitbucket Pipelines is banned from downloading packages at packages.npmjs.org. Pipelines containing npm install commands will therefore fail most of the time.

[Link to a gist to the complete error message in Pipeline logs|https://gist.github.com/achtsh/d26be0a9b789c635a6915449b17c9395]
fields.summary: Bitbucket Pipelines banned from packages.npmjs.org by Cloudflare

One of the branches is not listed in (filter by) Active or merged tab in branches view page. This issue is found in more than 4 (private) repositories. Disappeared branch shows in the list when I went to SourceTree ( branch already configured on my machine) and modified one file and did commitpush to the branch which is not listed on the web page.

fields.description:
Our documentation doesn't reflect a very vital piece of setting up the Pipelines notifications under _Chat settings_. You currently need the following values for notifications to be received.

# Notifications must be set on (configured)
# You must have "build succeeded" and "build failed" notifications selected
# You must have "pipelines fixed" / "pipelines succeeded" / "pipelines failed"

Missing either 2. or 3. is more than likely to confuse people-- we should make it clear that these notification options are linked.
fields.summary: Pipelines notifications via "Chat Settings" not clear

{code}
pipelines:
  default:
    services:
      - docker
    caches:
      - docker

{code}

However I'm not seeing any caching occurring - it still takes as long as it used to. How can I diagnose this issue?
fields.summary: Docker cache does not seem to be working?

Hi,

to make my life easier, can you please add a possibility to set a Pull Request as WIP (work in progress)

when the WIP status is removed, reset all approvals.

Thanks

Alex

fields.description:
To reproduce:

* create PR with feature branch that shall be merge to branch A
* merge code to branch B
* edit PR and try to edit merge branch from branch A to branch B
* at bottom of page BB displays\\
"No commits on feature-branch-name-here that aren't on merge-branch-here"\\
and disables Update pull request button

Expected behaviour:

* I shall be able to edit PR and change in what branch code shall be merged even if code is already merged
fields.summary: Can't edit PR and change merge branch if code is already merged

fields.description: Right now it is only possible to get webhook events for issue:created & issue:updated. But it would be neat if you could send webhook events when an issue is deleted as well.
fields.summary: Add issue:deleted webhook event

fields.description:
I'm viewing my code from the branch 'master'.\\
When I click edit (top right corner) the screen refreshes and the editor loads.\\
This loads the source file with a different branch, in my case 'mpande/ahm_batch'. This is not the default branch of my repo (under settings), nor is it the one I selected when browsing the code.

I expected the editor to use the branch I selected while browsing, so I can work at the file I just viewed.

This has a huge impact when not paying attention to the branch when the editor loads, my developers were sure they viewed the right branch and start editing, but end up editing the wrong one because of this strange editor behavior.

Browser: Chome 66, also seen under Edge (both Windows 10)
fields.summary: Clicking 'edit' switches current branch to different one

fields.description:
I am trying to integrate JIRA cloud with bitbucket cloud.\\
I am following the link https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/connect-bitbucket-cloud-to-jira-cloud-applications-814190686.html to do it.\\
However, i am getting "This add-on is misconfigured. Contact the vendor for assistance." message from JIRA.\\
And "No add-on was found at that URL. We received a 404 from the server. Double check the URL or contact the add-on vendor for help." from Bitbucket.\\
Is this because i am using free version? I found the link of bug report but it has not resolved yet. https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-65466\\
Please guide me how to fix this problem.
fields.summary: This add-on is misconfigured. Contact the vendor for assistance.

fields.description:
Our pull request contains a large file diff (11k lines) followed by many small file diffs. However, the one large file diff is causing all following diffs to be hidden. This is an inconvenience as it requires every user to repeatedly click-and-scroll to show the diffs, every time they reload the page.

Diff stat:

{code}
#!text
$ git diff --stat develop..PROJ-11
 .gitignore                                                |     1 -
 package-lock.json                                         | 11447 +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 package.json                                              |     4 +-
 src/app/app-routing.module.ts                             |    11 +-
 src/app/app.component.html                                |     5 +-
 src/app/app.component.ts                                  |     4 +
 src/app/app.module.ts                                     |     9 +-
 src/app/auth/auth-guard.service.ts                        |    39 +
 src/app/auth/auth-http-interceptor.ts                     |    39 +
 src/app/auth/authentication.service.spec.ts               |   273 +++++-
 src/app/auth/authentication.service.ts                    |   141 +++-
 src/app/auth/login-form/login-form.component.spec.ts      |   186 ++--
 src/app/auth/login-form/login-form.component.ts           |    18 +-
 src/app/product-header/product-header.component.html      |     4 +-
 src/app/product-header/product-header.component.ts        |    18 +-
 src/app/sighting/sighting-list/sighting-list.component.ts |     1 +
 src/app/sighting/sighting-routing.module.ts               |    23 +
 src/app/sighting/sighting.module.ts                       |     4 +-
 18 files changed, 12113 insertions(+), 114 deletions(-)
{code}

Screen shot attached.

Also, a related suggestion: the diff stat that Bitbucket shows at the top of the pull request won't load upon the same conditions. Why not load this diff stat separately to the large file diffs, so that the user can see just how many lines changed in the offending files with diffs too large to display?
fields.summary: "Diff too big" on small file diffs following a large file diff

fields.description:
I, like many developers, have many projects that are not updated, and we can not exclude those projects.\\
I think it would be interesting for the system to be able to mark these projects as depreciated.

It would not be any big change:

# In the "Your Work" page, that is, in the overview - dashboard - only the active projects would be listed.
# On the page listing the repositories all projects would be listed and there would be a filtering option where active and inactive repositories could be selected.
fields.summary: Allows you to mark a project as depreciated
PHP Heredoc is highlighted incorrectly on commit diff page.

fields.description:
In our current CI structure, we use the Deployments feature in Bitbucket heavily. It mostly works well, but there are some improvements to be made as detailed in other issues that have already been logged.

We also use HipChat on every project, and it's Bitbucket integration.

The problem is now that we use Deployments & Environments, the HipChat notifications are a lot less useful:

!4000589152-HipChat.png|thumbnail!

Sure we can see master branch building, but there's no context about which environment we're building to.

This wasn't a problem before Deployments arrived, as we used distinct branches for each environment and just merged code from branch to branch:

!1038992819-HipChat2.png|thumbnail!

As you can see, this was far more useful.

So, please add to the HipChat integration so that it tells use which Deployments are running & which Environments are being built to. Thanks!
fields.summary: HipChat integration does not support Deployments / Environments

fields.description: I would love to see a notification feature, especially for when someone comments on one of my PRs, or replies in a comment chain I am participating in.
fields.summary: Browser notifications

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to run deployment steps in parallel. I'm not sure why this is but I would certainly like this ability. I currently run multiple environments in production for the same application on AWS EB and would like to deploy to these environments in parallel.

I'm sure there are others that would do something similar.
fields.summary: Parallel deployments

fields.description:
Yesterday one of my pipelines needed 2 hours until it ran into a limit for the build duration. In my specific case it is clear that the build fails if it runs more than one minute.

It would be good, if users could restrict the maximum build duration theirselfs. I did not find a way to do that, so I suggest that functionality as enhancement.
fields.summary: Setting a maximum build duration for a pipeline

Model-based languages are receiving increasing interest and Modelica is, for sure, one of the most eminent.

Please add it to the Repository Details choices.
fields.summary: Add Modelica as Language in Repository Details

fields.description:
It compiles fine on 10.1 on both OS X and bitbucket\\
It compiles fine on 10.2 on OS X, but fails on bitbucket

bitbucket-pipelines.yml

image: node:10.2

pipelines:
    default:
        - step:
            caches:
                - node
            name: Test
            script:
                - npm install -g npm
                - npm ci

fields.description:
Currently all Issue Trackers are enabled from the repository itself. However it has to be enabled on each repository one by one.

It would be great if we could enable the Issue Tracker for all repositories in the account, globally.
fields.summary: Enable Issue Tracker for all repositories from an account level

fields.description:
Hi, when I want to create a new PR I get warnning (attachment 1).\\
If I press "Create Pull Request" after all, I get following error (attachment 2).\\
which I'm sure it's not true, because git diff command (with orgin braches) shows differences. This issue problem affects almost all branches in repository, especially main branch.
fields.summary: "Nothing to merge" issue

fields.description:
Pull requests often have files that are more or less important than others. While I can use comments to point out important or insignificant changes I'd like the ability to mark a file as "not worth looking at" which could collapse the contents in the page. I'd also like to be able to mark a file as important where it is highlighted in some way.

Collapsing project files or code files with only formatting changes would help clean up large pull requests and allow reviewers to focus on the important parts of a pull request.
fields.summary: Mark a file with a level of importance in a pull request

fields.description:
We have this simple pipeline configuration:

{code}
#!yaml

image: swite/node-karma-git

pipelines:
  branches:
    master:
    - step:
        name: Build & Test
        caches:
          - node
          - bower
        script:
          - npm install
          - ./node_modules/bower/bin/bower install --allow-root
          - ./node_modules/grunt-cli/bin/grunt
          - ./node_modules/karma/bin/karma start app/test/karma.conf.js

definitions:
  caches:
    bower: bower_components
{code}

If a user ("foo") merge something on the master branch, the pipeline starts but is somehow pushed by me.... and the alert mail is sent to my email.\\
If I follow the commit link, it's correctly been created by "foo".

Shouldn't it be pushed by "foo"? Do I have to modify my pipeline config?
fields.summary: Pipeline pushed by user who didn't commit

fields.description: I am encountering a problem transferring a repository to another account. I open the Settings tab, click on "Transfer repository", insert the username of the new owner, and finally click on "Transfer". No emails about the transfer request or confirmation arrive. I have tested by transferring to an individual user account and a team account. I tried revoking the transfers and re-trying. Nothing happens.
fields.summary: Missing transfer repository e-mail / notification

fields.description:
I had a service which I had misconfigured in my bitbucket-pipelines.yml by leaving out a required environment variable. As such, it was printing a line to STDOUT and then exiting immediately.

In Pipelines, it did not show that one line error message, so it was difficult to track down why it was failing.
fields.summary: Pipelines Service No Console Output from Quickly Terminating Service
Option for "--squash --ff-only" merge strategy

fields.description: When service containers are initiated, and one service container fails, then the main build will fail. We should provide a more useful error message in the main build log other than "No logs available"
fields.summary: Error message in main build log

fields.description:
When I select the "Deploy to AWS" on a commit, I get the error "Unable to download source code from Bitbucket".  I have been using this with no issues for about 6 months.  I was able to get it to work after retrying many times.

It would be helpful if the error message gave more information.

!1404119157-code-deploy-fail.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: AWS CodeDeploy fails: Unable to download source code from Bitbucket

fields.description:
Hi,

There is a bug that occurs with third-party applications if a user had had an application installed before, then revoked the access to it, and then install the application again.

Actually, I am from the StiltSoft team. We are an Atlassian Marketplace vendor and developer of the [File Viewer|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214164/file-viewer-for-bitbucket-cloud%3Fhosting%3Dcloud%26tab%3Doverview] add-on. The following are steps on how to reproduce the problem based on the example of this add-on:

* Install the File Viewer for Bitbucket Cloud add-on (Account settings - Find integrations).
* Open a [page|https://bitbucket.org/alexkuznetsov/demo-repo/src/dc6e80a236914c055173498a44d9e9c6f5baf642/csv/%3Fat%3Dmaster] with a file to open it via File Viewer. You will be prompted to grant access to your repositories for the add-on: !334733767-bb2.png|thumbnail!
* Go to the OAuth page (Account settings - OAuth).
* There is a record in the table that the add-on has been authorized to interact with my repositories: !206699593-bb1.png|thumbnail!
* Click the Revoke link in the table and uninstall the add-on.
* There is no record in the table.
* Install File Viewer again.
* Open a page with a file to open it via File Viewer. The "Grant access" dialog will not open. You cannot see the file on the page. There will be an 'Access denied' exception: !756283572-bb3.png|thumbnail!
* Go to the OAuth page. There will not be any mention of the add-on

The only way to fix it is to make a HTTP request at this URL (in a separate tab, for instance):\\
https://bitbucket.org/site/oauth2/authorize?client_id={client-id}&response_type=token.

We are using [AP.request API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/jsapi/request/] which is part of [Bitbucket Cloud JavaScript API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/about-the-javascript-api/]

I would expect AP.request to detect revoked token and I will be shown the "Grant access" dialog in which I can authorize the application for using my repositories.

Here is our initial request to Bitbucket Cloud Support https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/11/BBS-78600

Best regards,\\
Dmitry Zagorovsky
fields.summary: No way to authorize a third-party application after revoking access to it (Bitbucket Connect JS API AP.request)

fields.description:
The Docker build fails when installing npm with command npm install npm@latest -g, with the following error:

{code}
[91mError: could not get uid/gid

[0m[91mTypeError: Cannot read property 'get' of undefined
                 ^
TypeError: Cannot read property 'get' of undefined
    at process.errorHandler (/usr/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/utils/error-handler.js:205:18)
    at emitOne (events.js:116:13)
    at process.emit (events.js:211:7)
    at process._fatalException (bootstrap_node.js:374:26)
The command '/bin/sh -c apk add --update nodejs nodejs-npm && npm install npm@latest -g' returned a non-zero code: 7

{code}

When building the Docker-image locally it works without any problems.

Workaround is to set the "unsafe-perm" flag as true seems to fix this particular issue, but other node-related things may fail using this flag.
fields.summary: Pipelines failing with "could not get uid/gid" error

fields.description:
!1671194510-bitbucket%20commit%20user%20info%20bug.PNG|thumbnail!

I faced some unexpected behavior while committing to my repo. The commit record shows the name which is not a part of my repo as a member. The scenario on which I worked is (the description are based on attached screenshot):

# Previously, this machine was used by Sanjeev and he should have configured git for his repo
# Now this system is being used by other user "Santosh Prasad Sah" for another repo and "Sanjeev" is not part of this repo (private repo)
# But whenever "Santosh Prasad Sah" commits, the commit records on bitbucket displays "Sanjeev" as a committer

However, I managed to change the name after Global user configuration. But, in my opinion, Sanjeev must not be allowed to commit on this private repo in any way.
fields.summary: Commit record shows the name of member which is not a part of Private repo
